title.narrative: Studio Tamani - news and information for dialogue, peace and equality in Mali
Studio Tamani - nyheter och information för dialog, fred och jämlikhet i Mali

description.narrative:
Fondation Hirondelle, a non-profit organization based in Switzerland working to strengthen independent media in especially conflict-affected countries, has submitted an application to Sida for support to the project Studio Tamani - news and information for dialogue, peace and equality in Mali, for the period 2018-2022. Sida has previously contributed to Studio Tamami during the period 2015-2017. Studio Tamani is a media platform for professional and impartial news and information. Through a network of 70 local partner radios, covering 85% of Mali's population, daily news and debate programs are broadcasted in five languages. In addition, thematic programmes on children's and women's rights, shortly also on environmental and climate issues, are broadcasted every week. Moreover, social media are increasingly being used to reach especially the younger part of the population.
The overall objective of the intervention is to contribute to peace and development in Mali through information and dialogue between all peoples and all regions of the country and the two specific objectives are that the Malian population is better informed and more engaged in supporting the peace process, democracy, gender equality and a fairer society thanks to its access to independent, professional information and debate programs, and that Studio Tamani becomes a sustainable project run by a Malian legal entity and fully gender mainstreamed.
The total budget of the intervention is 87.2 MSEK, of which Sweden contributes with 51.6 MSEK. In addition to this amount, Sida provides 500 000 SEK to be disposed by Sida to support strengthening of Fondation Hirondelle's capacity for results based management. The other main donors are currently the EU and Denmark.

Fondation Hirondelle, en ideell organisation baserad i Schweiz som arbetar med att stärka oberoende media i framförallt konfliktdrabbade länder, har till Sida inkommit med en ansökan om stöd till projektet Studio Tamani - nyheter och information för dialog, fred och jämlikhet i Mali, under perioden 2018-2022. Sida har tidigare bidragit med stöd till Studio Tamani under perioden 2015-2017. Studio Tamani är en mediaplattform för produktion av professionella och opartiska nyheter och information. Genom ett nätverk av 70 lokala partnerradiostationer som täcker 85% av Malis befolkning sänds dagliga nyhets- och debattprogram på fem olika språk. Varje vecka sänds dessutom tematiska program om barns- och kvinnors rättigheter och inom kort även om miljö- och klimatfrågor. Sociala medier används också i allt högre utsträckning för att nå särskilt den yngre delen av befolkningen.
Det övergripande målet med insatsen är att bidra till fred och utveckling i Mali genom information och dialog mellan alla människor och regioner i landet. Det två specifika målen är att befolkningen är bättre informerad och mer engagerad i att stödja fredsprocessen, demokrati, jämställdhet och ett rättvisare samhälle tack vare tillgången till oberoende och professionella informations- och debattprogram, samt att Studio Tamani uppnår hållbarhet, drivs av en malisk juridisk person och är fullt jämställdhetsintegrerad.
Insatsens totala budget är 87,2 MSEK varav Sida bidrar med 51,6 MSEK. Utöver detta belopp tillhandahåller Sida 500 000 SEK som ska disponeras av Sida för att bidra till att stärka avtalsparten Fondation Hirondelles kapacitet för resultatbaserad styrning. De andra huvudsakliga givarna är i dagsläget EU och Danmark.

The overall objective of the intervention is to contribute to peace and development in Mali through information and dialogue between all peoples and all regions of the country. The two main expected results are that the Malian population is better informed and more engaged in supporting the peace process, democracy, gender-equality and the development of a fairer society thanks to its access to independent, professional information and debate programmes and that Studio Tamani at the end of the project period has become a sustainable project that is fully gender mainstreamed and run by a Malian entity.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

tag.narrative: 13.3 - Förbättra utbildningen, medvetenheten och den mänskliga och institutionella kapaciteten vad gäller begränsning av klimatförändringarna, klimatanpassning, begränsning av klimatförändringarnas konsekvenser samt tidig varning.
13.3 - Improve education, awareness-raising and human and institutional capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning.
16.1 - Avsevärt minska alla former av våld och dödligt våld överallt.
16.1 - Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere.
16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.b - Enhance the use of enabling technology, in particular information and communications technology, to promote the empowerment of women.
5.b - Öka användningen av gynnsam teknik, i synnerhet informations- och kommunikationsteknik, för att främja kvinnors egenmakt

title.narrative: Agreement on contribution to Studio Tamani
Decision on contribution to Studio Tamani

description.narrative: During 2020, Studio Tamani continued its mission of informing and promoting dialog between all regions and citizens. Several activities were carried out in order to achieve the defined objectives. Covering and treating news The legislative elections, postponed many times since 2018, have been announced for the end of March 2020. Studio Tamani accompanied the electoral process with precise and strict editorial provisions. 4 training workshops of 3 days each in Bamako (3) and Ségou (1) brought together journalists from all regions of Mali. These trainings were an opportunity to review the fundamentals of journalism (accuracy, clarity, balance and neutrality, independence and honesty) and to train participants on the specificities of journalism during an election period. Activities linked to legislative elections were covered according to an electoral with three different but interlinked periods: before elections, the elections day and post-elections. Young people were particularly targeted through the Youth Program broadcast on Saturdays and Sundays, in order to encourage them to take an interest in the current electoral process, to register themselves and to vote. Onset of the COVID 19 The editorial staff of the Fondation Hirondelle, including Studio Tamani, from the beginning of March put in place measures to best protect their staff. Fondation Hirondelle set-up a contingency plan in March, which was adapted by each of the editorial staff. With regard to Studio Tamani, the contingency plan provided for the following measures: . Adaptations to the organization of editorial staff and the production of programs. . The reduction of outdoor reporting. “Stopping travel outside the capital". . A preference for studio recordings and telephone interventions. At the same time, adaptations have been made to productions, consisting in particular of the rebroadcasting of certain programs, dual-flow operation and reduction of teams, or even the limitation of outings and travel. At the editorial level, new sections were created in March: . a 3-minute daily magazine devoted to COVID and its repercussions and a 15-minute weekly cultural magazine dedicated to COVID and broadcast on Saturdays and Sundays within of the youth program. Prevention spots in 7 languages, therefore in two additional languages (Soninké and Torosso), were produced and broadcast in order to reach as many people as possible. Studio Tamani launched its radio education program on June 2020. This program is a response to the multidimensional crisis that affects the country's education system. In addition to the pre-existing structural problems (lack of teachers, precarious infrastructure, insufficient equipment, difficulties of access, etc.) there is added growing insecurity in many localities, the teachers' strike which lasted almost a year between 2019 and 2020, and finally the COVID19 crisis. The issues of both quality and accessibility of the education sector are aggravated, and it is expected that the number of children out of school in the long term will increase. Thus, with the launch of the radio education program, Studio Tamani has joined the efforts of the Ministry of Education and its partners to maintain educational continuity as much as possible. As part of the radio education program, Studio Tamani works in partnership with the Ministry of Education, the National Directorate of Basic Education, the Norwegian Refugee Council and UNICEF. In doing so, we offer one hour of program per day on the basics of reading / writing and arithmetic. Our program covers levels 1 to 6 of basic education, with the target audience for out-of-school children between the ages of 7 and 12. Studio Tamani also provided information to Malian citizens in real time via social networks, the website, and news papers during the coup d'état in August 2020. It provided live coverage of the two days of validation of the terms of reference for the transition and the three days of national consultations which took place on September 5 and 6 and from September 11 to 13. Our assessment of the rate of achievement The greatest attention to local languages, the reports produced in the regions partly explain the achievement of the results mentioned above. In addition, collecting information related to the situation of women In addition, the fact of collecting information related to the situation of women and a greater involvement of women in the animation of radio programs (Grand Débat) have improved the quality of programs. The consideration of environmental issues has also made it possible to broaden the range of programs to be disseminated and to raise awareness among the populations on environmental risks. Studio Tamani also collaborates with media organizations, NGOs or companies, national and international partners. At the same time, Studio Tamani very regularly uses the expertise of NGOs to feed or intervene in its productions.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
